name: Four Points by Sheraton College Station

reviews.text: I got a fantastic deal on this hotel through an online travel site. I've previously stayed at a newly constructed Four Points hotel in Oklahoma City, and it was an enjoyable experience. Obviously, I had similarly high expectations for this hotel. We were in town for a college graduation.
reviews.title: Just Okay.

reviews.text: Location: Great, close to the A&M campus. Many retail and dining options close by.
reviews.title: Could not get over the musty odor....

reviews.text: Room: The room was clean, the air conditioner worked great, and the bed was comfortable. We never heard a peep out of our neighbors, and we slept well. However, as a previous poster mentioned, there is a slight musty odor in the hotel. I noticed it upon entering the lobby, and continued to notice it in our room. Eventually I grew accustomed to the smell, and it didn't bother me.
reviews.title: #23 of 29? Really?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: Yikes. This hotel was at full capacity during our stay because it was graduation weekend. The service at the front desk was friendly and efficient. However, we visited the bar one evening and the service was terrible. There was only one bar tender/waitress working, and poor thing, she was totally overwhelmed. We took at seat at the bar, waited for about 15 minutes without even being acknowledged, then left. Again, at breakfast the next morning, we took a seat, and although the restaurant/bar appeared to have several additional staff members working, we were never acknowledged. A member of our party went through the buffet, and returned with a plate of COLD eggs. Not lukewarm, cold. Not too appetizing. We left $3 on the table, and left to find morning grub at an area restaurant.
reviews.title: bring your earplugs

reviews.text: All in all, it was an OK stay. The accommodations were adequate, but the service in the bar/restaurant was terrible. Would I stay here again? Maybe, if I could get a good deal. Would I pay "retail" for a room at this hotel? Absolutely not.
reviews.title: About time for a good hotel at reasonable rates

reviews.text: My husband and I and my son and his family stayed in 2 adjoining rooms. The beds were clean and comfortable. The kids went swimming in the pool and the pool area had fresh towels. This area was safe and clean. The breakfast had a variety and was a delicious hot meal. The staff was friendly and there was plenty of free parking close to the building. The hotel itself had been completely renovated for 9 months and then opened in October 2011. I thought the decor was up to date and fashionable. I would stay in this hotel again. We got our 2 rooms on Priceline and we got a great deal. The money we saved bought all of us (7 of us) a nice dinner.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Price
Shame on Sheraton
reviews.text: The only thing I saw that needed help was the thermostat in our room. The room was very nice and cool, but we never could figure how to make it work. Otherwise, great hotel!

All the paint and carpet in the world doesn't negate the fact that this was a 30 year old Holiday Inn in a previous life in the parking lot of a strip mall. Extremely dangerous access into and out of parking lot. Walls were paper thin. One of queen beds in our room had blood on the sheets. While it was most likely old, bleached blood it was still not what a guest wants to see. We reserved this room through Priceline. Anytime in the Bryan/College Station area you should use caution choosing Priceline because you may get a really fabulous place and you may may get something less than desirable. Not what you expect from Sheraton. Would not choose to stay here again.
reviews.title: NIce Hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in May 2012. We only stayed 1 night but found the hotel to be clean with rooms that were fairly recently refurbished. The staff was polite and helpful when asked about surrounding businesses. The bed was comfortable and the room was nice especially considering the price. My only complaint (and I often find this to be the case in hotels) was that there was a slight gap in the curtain that allowed sunlight in the room in the morning. It would have been nice to sleep in. Oh well, still a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Won't stay here again

reviews.text: We stayed here because there were few rooms left in the town for our one night stay. We've found that staying at a Four Points is always rolling the dice as it might be very good, or it might be very poor. This hotel is on the lower end. I wouldn't give it high marks for cleanliness though it has been redecorated. All white bathrooms mean seeing a lot of dirt, hair, etc. that a guest generally doesn't want to see. Also, they cannot guarantee what type of room you will get. We booked a king bed and got 2 queens. When we asked for the king, they said they were all taken and that they never guarantee which you will get. Not great customer service. For over $110/night, this was no where near a decent value.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: -Average but clean four points sheraton
reviews.title: average but clean four points sheraton

reviews.text: -Good location near stores, food, etc
reviews.title: Ok, convientant to my granddaughter's dorm.

reviews.text: -Just a generic hotel with no soul but this is not Paris... so it works for me when I am in the College Station area
reviews.title: Stay away from the bar

reviews.text: -People who work there are friendly
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable.

reviews.text: The rooms are pretty good and clean except for the carpets stains. One would think the hotel would have that area the cleanest; after all, it is seen by everyone. Soft bed/pillows. The sofa pull-outs are hard as a rock though.
reviews.title: Clean Hotel

reviews.text: I was very excited to book 2 rooms at this hotel for the weekend of A&M vs LSU!
reviews.title: Charges $500 Deposits 6 Months in Advance and Does Not Refund

reviews.text: This was one of the only hotels still available (in December 2011) in town after the game was announced.
reviews.title: Texas hospitality for traveling Tiger Fans

reviews.text: Out of the blue and without any notice, on April 26th I noticed two charges on my credit card for the amount of $526. Turns out that is the full amount + taxes for the hotel stays which should have occurred at the end of October. That's over $1K. That's a lot of money!
reviews.title: Wonderful, as usual!

reviews.text: I called the hotel to inquire about the charges. The girl at the front desk had no idea. When I finally talked to someone else ( the manager I think ), he said those charges were deposits.
reviews.title: Aggie move-in day

reviews.text: What hotel charges the full amount as deposit 6 months in advance?!?!?
reviews.title: Great stay in Aggieland

description: The Four Points by Sheraton College Station is near Texas A&M University. Onsite, we have a 2,200 sq ft ballroom that can be divided into smaller meeting rooms for more intimate gatherings.
